title: New Orleans for Mardi Gras and Havana for its boisterous nightlife
text:
8 shares 1

comments
A cocktail at sail away, watching the sunset from the deck is one of the joys of cruising.
But don’t you sometimes wish you could stay in port all evening to join the locals for dinner in a lively square, go to the opera or a concert, or stroll off the ship for a nightcap?
Staying overnight in port started with a handful of small, luxury ships such as SeaDream I and II (seadream.com, 0800 783 1373) giving their customers a taste of the fleshpots of St Tropez where the nightlife doesn’t get going until midnight.
New Orleans hotels book up in advance for Mardi Gras, but the Celebrity Equinox spends two nights in port
Now more ships of all sizes are staying a night or two in ports all over the world, offering evening excursions, sometimes coinciding with a special event.
Every hotel room in New Orleans is booked up years in advance for Mardi Gras, when the French Quarter throngs with floats and jazz bands.
But book now for 2017 and you can soak up the carnival atmosphere, staying in port for two nights aboard Celebrity Equinox (celebritycruises.co.uk, 0845 456 0523) as part of an 11-night Caribbean cruise from Fort Lauderdale in Florida on February 20, 2017. The cruise-only fare is from £1,531pp.

A renowned spa, four Michelin-starred restaurants, miles of... If you have more time to spare, how about joining a no-fly, Grand Caribbean Adventure aboard Saga Pearl II (travel.saga.co.uk/cruises, 0800 092 9083), sailing for 42 nights from Southampton on November 8, 2016?
You’ll stay overnight in Havana, where dancing under the stars at the Tropicana Club, a hotspot for Latin music and cabaret since 1939, is a Cuban experience not to be missed.
The fly-cruise starts at £6,022pp.
Crystal Symphony sails from Lisbon to Tilbury on the Thames, with a stop in St Jean de Luz (pictured)
Book now to get chauffeur service from home, free travel insurance, wi-fi, drinks and gratuities.
A 13-night Rivers Of France & Spain cruise next spring has three overnight stays – in Seville, the home of flamenco, Rouen, giving time to enjoy the nightlife of Paris, and Bordeaux, the great centre of French wine.
Sail from Dover on March 18, 2016 aboard Fred.Olsen’s Braemar (fredolsen cruises.com, 0800 035 5242). Fares are from £1,299pp.
Another cruise with opportunities to enjoy Paris by night and a gala dinner in Bordeaux is with luxury, all-inclusive line Crystal Cruises (crystalcruises.co.uk, 020 7399 7601).
Crystal Symphony sails from Lisbon to Tilbury on the Thames for 14 nights on May 22, 2016.
The ship stays overnight in the seaside town of St Jean de Luz, which is renowned for its Basque cuisine. Fares, from £4,079pp, include flight to Lisbon, drinks on board and gratuities.
Take an 11-night Acropolis, Rome And Florence cruise on Azamara Journey (azamaraclubcruises.co.uk, 0844 493 4016) and you’ll be treated to an evening at the grand Goldoni Theatre in Livorno, where three tenors will be performing.
The ship stays overnight in Monaco and Sorrento, too, and doesn’t sail until 11pm from Valletta, the capital of Malta.
